comment: no idea why his rating low! he is amazing and his grading is so clear. it's all just homework and tests. the class itself was easy, but he provided excellent lectures to help with understanding everything. i have taken him for 2 math classes and he is amazing.

Professor Covarrubias is amazing, he goes the extra mile to make sure you understand before moving on to the next segment. He is very accessible and responds to emails. He is passionate about mathematics. Exams are hard, but he prepares you with materials before hand. Highly recommend taking his courses.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Had him for Calc 1. Literally taught us like 1 on 1. Hes carries you and teaches you trying his best to make sure that you understand. I dont know if it was just me but it was an easy A in calc. His teaching methods are extremely clear, highly recommend.

Professor Francisco is an amazing professor. He will throughly explain problems for you. He is willing to go over the problem 5 times just for you to understand. I like how he understands that Calc is hard and tries to make it easier for us. His test are just like the study guide and you can use your notes. He does have a thick accent.

He has changed how he teaches his class so the previous comments don't really accurately describe him right now. He lets you use the study guide on tests and his tests are basically the study guide but with different numbers. Super easy class if you just do the homework. If you have trouble on stuff, his SI is really really helpful.

His accent is a little strong but isnt too bad. When I had a family emergency he was very understanding and allowed me to take my test online. This professor was super nice and always responded to my emails. Even though I only seen him 1 out of 2 days a week (Covid rules) it wasnt too bad.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He does have an accent, but it isn't that hard to understand him. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he does replace the lowest test grade with your final if you have good attendance. Homework assignments on my math lab for every unit, usually 1 due every week. Tests are exactly like the study guides. He is very nice and tries to bring humor to class.

This professor was the absolute WORST professor I've ever had. He made his math class so hard and he was hard to understand. Doesn't follow MML and refuses to use the formulas that work. If he's the only class that is open and you're on a scholarship or care about your GPA DO NOT TAKE HIM. This dood doesn't care if you understand or don't.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Never responds to emails so don't even bother. Tests are nothing like study guides. I was confused all the time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is a really nice guy but he's hard to understand sometimes because of his accent. He goes so fast that he will get problems wrong. Uses Alek's for test and homework. Attendance isn't mandatory but you get extra credit for if you go. He allowed a retest for us bc everyone did so bad on test #2 && allows you to make a formula sheet for the test.

He's an alright guy on a personal level, I guess, but that doesn't change the fact everyone in my class did so poorly on the first test that he decided to scrap the grades and give the entire class a redo the following week...
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tough grader

comment: NO!!! Very nice guy, but if you don't understand the concepts, he fails to understand how. He does problems straight from the board and doesn't explain why he gets the answers he does. Uses MyMathLab for test and if you type one thing in wrong he doesn't fix it. Again he kept telling us he wanted to treat us like a CALC class even though it wasn't.

Horrible professor. Hard to understand, never clear with his instructions and uses math lab which, if you accidentally type something wrong or if it counts it wrong even when it's right, he refuses to change the grade. You can only use a four function calculator on tests or a stupid excel calculator that is confusing because he fails to explain it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is a nice guy but he is not very clear about what he wants. He does not really respond to anyone's emails. He does not really help the students that need it and only focuses on the students who are doing well. Also, the tests are on my mathlab and if you dont put the exact answer it counts it wrong
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: 1 word PISCES! He was the nicest professor I have ever had! At the time, he was new to the school, so he was still trying to figure out his lesson plans, homework, curriculum, etc. If you put in the work and attend class everyday, he will help you! Gives extra credit, curves, lots of partial credit on exams.
He doesnt particularly explain things clearly and rushes through lessons. Youre basically teaching yourself the course. Would not recommend.

He's not a bad guy or anything, he just doesn't teach Calculus (which is a very difficult subject) at a level that we can understand. He teaches at a fast pace and there were only five grades in the class. 4 were tests with around 3 to 10 questions each. Gives some extra credit though.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: There are 50 us enrolled in our math class. On average around 15 show up. For those who show up he will help relentlessly with extra credit and give us strong pointers for the upcoming tests. Although he is very foreign and has a thick accent and is hard to understand sometimes, he knows what he is teaching. Very helpful office hour sessions aswell
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Avoid at all cost... by far the worst professor i have ever takin, if u ask questions its almost like he doesn't even know what he's teaching and you just end up getting more lost, he made the mistake of putting a excel spreadsheet up on the screen by accident and from the 10 scores the avg test was 36%
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader
